result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L Dixon

records.addlTxt: Per DCPS violation report, Court orders body-only bench warrant.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: issue body-only bench warrant

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SAK.
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of SAK. 
- Defendant shall not be on Brittany Pl.
- Defendant shall not be in the 1700-2200 block of Mckenna Blvd.
- Defendant shall not be in the 6400-6800 blocks of Raymond Rd.
Trial Judge - Br 2
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

2:08 PM Defendant Brandon L Dixon in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Brandon L Dixon.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
